title: ICE on mismatched trait impl types on nightly
body:
https://is.gd/IOhgyC

``` rust
struct S;

trait Trait {
    fn bar(f: fn() -> &'static u8);
}

impl Trait for S {
    fn bar(_: fn() -> u8) {}
}

fn main() {}
```

```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', ../src/libcore/option.rs:326
stack backtrace:

  15:     0x7fe5cb68fd4b - rustc_typeck::check::check_item_types::h81e44a5d40f450fd

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
```

Happens on the current nightly, but not the beta/stable rustc installed on the playpen.
